citeinfo.title: Sea Level Rise exposure by 2100 in census block groups under a 1 meter of sea level rise by 2100 scenario for Corpus Christi Bay, Texas.

serinfo.sername: TNC Coastal Conservation and Resiliency Analyses

pubinfo.pubplace: 205 N. Carizzo Street, Corpus Christi, TX, 78401, US

citeinfo.title: Informing conservation and resiliency planning using sea-level rise and storm-surge scenario impact estimates in Corpus Christi Bay

serinfo.sername: TNC Coastal Conservation and Resiliency Analyses

descript.abstract: This analysis shows the percentage of each census block group in the Corpus Christi Bay region of Texas potentially exposed to 1 meter of SLR in the year 2100.
descript.purpose: This file was created for The Nature Conservancy's Sea Level Rise Project for the northern Gulf of Mexico with funding from the Coastal Bend Bays and Estuary Program (CBBEP). This dataset shows the percentage of each block group in Corpus Christi Bay, Texas that are potentially exposed to 1 meter of SLR in the year 2100. The map represents the extent of estuarine and open ocean water inundation that might occur under a 1 meter of sea level rise by 2100 scenario, which were derived from predicted landcover maps of Corpus Christi Bay, Texas. The landcover maps used for the study area were derived from Sea Level Rise Affecting Marsh Model (SLAMM) using the 1m of sea-level rise by 2100 scenario which predict how marshes might migrate inland due to increasing sea levels.

procstep.procdesc: TNC Conservation and Resiliency analyses were created from SLAMM and ADCIRC modeling outputs for Corpus Christi Bay, Texas (see reports at www.SLRportal.org)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier for each block group

attrdomv.udom: Area in sq. meters defining the features.
Area (sq. meters) of inundation by sea level rise within the block group features.

attr.attrdef: Sea level rise percent of block group inundated in 2100

attrdomv.udom: Percent of block group area (0-100) exposed to sea level rise inundation

attrdomv.udom: Exposure ranking descriptions based on SLR_EXP_1 (none, low, moderate and high)
